person.handwriting: The hand is generally careful and largely detached; it has enough style to be recognizable as of its period, but it shows signs of stress and unevenness. The greetings are added as an afterthought, perhaps after "farewell"had already be written, and they are tucked in awkwardly. (Bagnall-Cribiore 2006, p.107)
person.name: Dionysia

person.handwriting: Farewell: Written in a somewhat exaggerated hand, which the editor thought might be a different hand, as indeed he thought the greetings all were; but it looks rather like the same writer trying to write in a different style. (Bagnall-Cribiore 2006, p.108)
person.name: Dionysia
